headline: Easy Oreo Truffles
description: These Oreo truffles are bite-sized chocolate-covered treats easily made with 3 simple ingredients: Oreo cookies, cream cheese, and melted chocolate.

video.description: These truffles are very easy and delicious. You can't go wrong with OREO, cream cheese and chocolate!
video.name: How to Make Easy OREO Truffles

name: Easy Oreo Truffles
recipeIngredient: 16 ounces cream-filled chocolate sandwich cookies (such as Oreo®), divided

recipeInstructions.text: Melt chocolate in a saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally, 4 to 6 minutes.
While the chocolate is melting, place 9 cream-filled sandwich cookies in a food processor and blend until finely crushed. Transfer crumbs to a bowl and reserve for decorating.

Add remaining cookies to the food processor and blend until finely crushed. Transfer crumbs to a large bowl and stir in cream cheese; mix until well-blended. Roll mixture into 42 balls, about 1-inch in diameter.

Place each ball in melted chocolate and use two forks to roll it until fully coated. Lift the ball with both forks and allow excess chocolate to drip off. Place coated truffle on a wax paper-lined baking sheet and sprinkle with reserved cookie crumbs to decorate. Repeat to make remaining truffles.
Refrigerate truffles until firm, at least 1 hour. Keep in the refrigerator until just before serving.

review.reviewBody: Soooo good, and easy!

Followed the recipe completely and everyone seems to love them! This time I'm going to try using mint oreos and having them dipped in white chocolate candy cane kisses and a double stuff dipped in semi sweet chocolate chips.
so awesome and so delicious my family loved it!
I use Ghirardelli Dark melting wafers...delicious

I followed the recipe exactly and these were rich, smooth, and delicious. At the end I felt that working with almond bark was easier then semi-sweet. Here's a tip that makes dipping them in chocolate super easy: After rolling your truffles into balls, place a tooth pick in each one, then freeze for about 2 hours. Before taking them out of the freezer, prepare your melted chocolate. Then remove the truffles from the freezer and dip each one into the chocolate completely - all the way to the toothpick. I placed each dipped truffle back on the waxed paper-lined cookie sheet. You can remove the toothpick by twisting it and out it should come and some of the chocolate should then run into the toothpick hole. For some I waited to remove the picks until I was done dipping, and I used my finger tip to dip into the melted chocolate and fill each toothpick hole so that I would have some wet chocolate to sprinkle the remaining Oreo cookie crumbs. You could also cover a toothpick hole by piping stripes with opposite color chocolate. SO EASY and fun. I may make another batch!!
Oreos has a toffee crunch version, wow! Made crunchier truffles! Also put in mini muffin pan with liners and drizzled chocolate then added crumbs!
Loved it! So easy and yummy!..a little on the messy side but it’s ok the taste is so worth it! :)

They were good. Except I would like to make them with double stuff oreos so I can get more of the cream inside. It was getting a bit crumbly at the end, was not able to make 32. Made like 20. I think I also want to dry with melted milk chocolate. But overall it was great. I will make again. My 6 year old is picky and she actually enjoyed these.
I struggled with the assembly of these and I found the final result not worth all the effort.
Delicious!
This is a great desert/treat everyone I gave one too loved it, though I did make my a bit bigger that others.

This was one of the easiest dessert recipes I’ve ever made. I tweaked it a little bit by adding white chocolate on top of the truffles and adding a small spoonful of shortening to both chocolates as they melted on the stovetop on low heat, whisking continuously. The chocolate cured perfectly. I kept them in the fridge until ready to eat and they turned out great. I’ve been asked several times to make them again.

Have been making these for years. They are yummy! For all the negative reviews stating they didn't firm up or were mushy at room temp...did you use a package of oreos ?
 Or a POUND (16 ounces)of oreos ?? A typical package is now around 12 ounces - not a pound. You have to add more.
Excellent recipe and great tasting! Recipe is a little labor intense for people new to cooking, but the payoff is worth the effort!
Very easy, but I replaced chocolate coating with white chocolate for a more cookies & cream flavor. Also note: current Oreo packaging is family size less 3 cookies (regular size is only 12 oz now)
Very easy to make. Taste great.

Have made these and I find that the double boiler method (once chips melt keep on lowest heat) works best to keep the chocolate fluid. I also use two forks to get them out of the chocolate bath. We personally like white chocolate but any will make them disappear pretty quickly . Love these every Christmas!
Yum!

These turned out so great! So moist and yummy! I dipped mine in both dark and white chocolate truly so yummy! You can also melt white chocolate then put It A piping bag then drizzle on top instead of crumbling Oreos! The whole family loved! Will use this recipe again
Turned out great! Taste very good!! A little rich, maybe save for a special occasion as they are very sugary
I made a little changes I did half white choacolte and dark

I love these things!! They are especially good with white chocolate too if you wanted to mix it up or not have chocolate on chocolate! Also I just ground up 4 Oreos and not 9 cause 4 is more than enough and these are a family favorite at my house!! Must try!!
Very easy to make. I used mint oreos. They were all gone before I had a chance to try one. I guess they were good!
Great recipe! they are easy and delicious! I added some coconut oil to chocolate chips before melting, and used a spoon and a fork for dipping.
You will more chocolate than the recipe says. I needed about double to cover all the truffles
mine looks like it came from nailed it
YUM!!
easy and delicious!
After rolling them into balls, i refrigerated them before dipping into chocolate coating.
These were amazing! My friends at college absolutely fell in love with them, begged me to make some more for when we're back on campus!
Very easy to to Make, I have made for friends , Family, as well as for Fundraisers... with the variety of Oreo Cookies out there , there is a lot of choices to make them..
Easy, fun, and very delicious. Will say they are very very rich, but also very delicious.

This is one of my favorite truffle recipes. I add 1tsp of vanilla extract to the cream cheese and Oreo mix and I get compliments every time I make them. They look professionally made and they taste heavenly.
Perfect recipe & helpful notes! I can’t add anything except take the time-it’ll be worth it!
Way, Way too yummy
best tasting cookies in the world!!!!!!!!!!

These are an instant hit! They are the most requested “Cooke” that I make at Christmas time. Plus, with the flavor variety that Oreo offers, the possibilities are endless. Other than the original, mint is the second best according to friends and family. I also use the thin Oreos because they are easier to crush and the cream cheese flavor really comes through for a more cheesecake taste.
Delicious! Easy and sold out at the bake sale!
Absolutely delicious!!! 5 stars
I loved this recipe ! very easy to eat.

These are ah-mazing! I tried the 'batter' and thought they weren't so great.... but the finished product was fantastic.

I added a few peppermint Dove squares which gave a great subtle peppermint flavor. I would totally do this again.

I think next time I would set aside less cookie crumbs as I had more than enough left over. From 9 i would probably do 6 and thus add more to the mix.

I used Newman's wheat free "oreos" and it turned out well, just not as many "balls" since there are less cookies in the container. I'm a big fan of this recipe.
Very moist and gooey inside.
Delicious! A big hit at Christmas!

This was super easy. My 9 year old did all of it except the dipping in chocolate part, which was even easier using the 2 spoon trick I read here than anything I've had to dip before. These were delicious and people raved about them. We will make these for Christmas every year now.

Great recipe. If you like mint, it’s also great using the mint Oreos. To make dipping easier, I used cake pop sticks and decorated the outside as the chocolate cooling I decorated them for Xmas. Would be easy to incorporate all sorts of holiday themes.
I will make this again, going to try peppermint bark Oreos dipped in white chocolate

Super easy to make. Great for a last minute dessert idea or for fun with the kids. I suggest you freeze or refrigerate the balls before you dip them in chocolate, it helps keep their shape when dipping.
Easy and tasty, although I found the dipping into chocolate rather messy.

I make a mint version for the holidays. I use regular oreos, blend them in the food processor, add about a teaspoon peppermint extract. Then I work in cream cheese with a spoon, then knead by hand to ensure a good mixture. I don't always chill them, but I let them sit in a stainless steel bowl, so I think the chill from the cream cheese remains. I use two bakers chocolate semi-sweet bars and melt in a double boiler with a couple of T of crisco to ensure a smooth texture. I added another 1/2 teaspoon of peppermint extract and topped the dipped balls with crushed candy cane.
Made this recipe several times kids love it
My kids look forward to me making these every year at Christmas time. I like to keep them in the freezer, they don’t get overly hard and are a perfect cool treat.
I loved how super easy they were to make and to top it off yummy! 5 stars for sure
Pretty awesome
I added powder sugar on top instead of dipping in melted semi sweet chocolate chips and it was really good just add powder sugar before u put a n fridge

So delicious. I used off brand cookies and had 10 less in the package but they still turned out great. I also just used semi sweet chocolate chips for dipping. It takes focus and some patience but the outcome is worth it.
Yes I will make it again, everyone loved them. With the red Oreo icing middle it looked festive on its own with crumbs on top

Variations - instead of Oreos, use: 
- 1/2 package crushed graham crackers plus 2 tbsp amaretto, covered in white chocolate
- 1 package crushed keebler pecan sandies plus 3 tbsp rum
- about 30 crushed vanilla wafer cookies plus 1/4 cup mini chocolate chips
- vanilla sandwich cookies, colorful sprinkles
- lemon sandwich cookies, key lime juice, 2 drops green food coloring (covered in white chocolate, rolled in graham cracker crumbs) 
- or add peppermint extract to the Oreos for a mint version

I made these and they were delicious and such a crowd pleaser! I doubled the batch and used 1 double stuf oreo pack and one regular. I froze the batter before making the balls, then froze again before coating in chocolate. Personally I needed probably double the amount of baking chocolate or at least one extra pack per batch but people wanted to buy some off me! super delicious

I decided to mix this up and use the peppermint Oreos. It was a wonderful twist! I will say that I struggled at first because the batter was too soft to effectively dip in the chocolate. So I rolled the truffles into balls and put them in the freezer for about 25 minutes. I used chocolate chips that I melted in the microwave and they worked just as well. The only thing you have to be careful of is, make sure you are generous when dipping the balls or they will just end up frustrating you.???
Holy Cow! These are so good and so easy!!
everyone loved them. I served 3-5 with french vanilla ice cream for a dessert. yum! I used a rounded measuring spoon to make equal-sized round balls.
I melted the chocolate over a hot pot of boiling water in a small bowl and used 4 bags instead of two for dipping the truffles
Very easy recipe to follow. Made these for Christmas gifts
super good nice for parties
Easy enough but hard to keep solid even on a cool day at room temperature. Still went pretty good but no complements.

I’ve made this numerous times, very simple recipe so it’s hard to go wrong. Reading the reviews helped. I made the balls then covered and refrigerated a few hours. I believe the chilling made it so much easier to coat them with chocolate.
Super easy to make, just a little time consuming. I doubled the recipe and everyone loved them!
It was so good I’ll definitely make it like as many times as possible
These are incredible. Will definitely make again
Wonderful with Golden Oreo in the Chocolate Oreo mix
I hated to give them away!
This recipe is simple and easy to make, and was a big hit with my friends
They were amazing! My family loved them.
I liked these but the chocolate was to sweet so i rolled them in oreo it was really good

My daughter and I made this for a small gathering. We only made half a recipe which yielded 18 truffles. The flavor was very good and it was easy to make. However, we did not crush the cookies too finely since it was hard to make the truffles with the fine crumbs. We would definitely make it again.
Very messy but good. Used tooth picks. That didn’t go so well but it worked. These are very rich but everyone loved them.
I added a Tbsp of oil to the melted chocolate. It made a huge difference! These were SUCH a hit over the holidays!

These are a favorite around the holidays.. I coat with both regular chocolate and white chocolate.. great to gift to a hostesses home you are visiting or pulling them out for unexpected company.. they freeze well too
Easy to make . Big hit
quick recipe. no baking. Second time I made them, they were very soft and mushy. I tried to double the recipe and they were mushy. Had to add more crushed oreos but had the same out put.
I will make it again.

I've made these a lot in the past. I have a couple of questions for anyone who can answer it. Can these be made 2 weeks ahead of Christmas ? Are these okay to freeze like I do peanut butter bon bons. I freeze them and they do good in the freezer then bring therm out and let them sit out of the container to defrost. I just want to make as many of my cookies ahead of time as I can. Thank you for your help in advance
We do not save some cookie crumbs to use at the end. Love this easy, delicious dessert. These are a hit at every event we take them to.

Turned out great! So cute! We used double stuffed cookies and it turned out fine, we also used Neufchâtel cheese instead of cream cheese also turned out fine. You probably don’t want to use milk chocolate, we did that and then the truffles were to sweet. We put them in the fridge before we dipped them. Yummy! Thanks for the recipe!

So easy and so fantastic! I put the truffles in the freezer for 10 minutes before coating with Ghirardelli melting wafers, used a fork to roll them and a spoon to cover any missed spots, so no problems at all with them falling apart while coating.
These are amazin and I will definetly make these again
Came out great!
The only thing I did differently, is I put the balls in the freezer for about 20 minutes before dipping in the chocolate. Good stuff!
Delicious. I made mine with white baking chocolate and semi-sweet chocolate chips.
Fabulous! Everyone loved these and requested recipe. They are definitely going to be on our regular dessert menu.
really good! kinda messy but over all really good!
These are good, but super sweet and rich.

I thought that the recipe could have used a little work, because they didn't have the right number of Oreos in a package so there weren't enough Oreos for the top crumble, there wasn't enough white chocolate to cover all the balls and I ended up having to melt over twice the amount. I wish they'd given more specifics too, and it would have been easier to chill the balls before trying to dip. Big mistake! Flavor was good, but too sweet for my tastes. Overall, definitely not my cup of tea.
Awesome sweet treat. Easy to make

These are amazing, but beware that they are not for the novice or impatient! This was a 2 day project. Your chocolate can easily harden, and it can be tough to wrap the oreo mixture in the chocolate sauce. So be patient, and it if you make it to the end, you are likely to leave your guest in a chocolate coma! We suggest trying to warp the oreo mixture in some other things such as caramel or peppermint bark (which surprisingly 5 different stores had never heard of!). Those are easier to work with, and make the treats a little less sweet. I chose to top them with a strawberry puree, which blended fabulously, and also made for a much more beautiful presentation than all black. It is well worth all the effort.
Made this for my Sunday School class. Everyone absolutely loved these. So delicious!
Ummm, what's not to like? To go faster, melt the chocolate as your first step.

This wasn't my favorite. Made exactly as recipe said and took them to a work function and they were not a hit. Not sure if it was the brand of chocolate I used but they weren't good. Way too rich and they get melty and mushy if not in a cold environment.
I freeze the balls before dipping in white almond bark.
